title: Undiscovered Gems In Middle East For August 2025
description: The Middle East markets have recently experienced mixed performances, with Gulf shares fluctuating in response to corporate earnings and the anticipation of U.S. inflation data, which could influence monetary policy decisions impacting the region. Amidst this backdrop, identifying promising stocks involves looking for companies that demonstrate resilience and potential growth despite broader market volatility.
content:
The Middle East markets have recently experienced mixed performances, with Gulf shares fluctuating in response to corporate earnings and the anticipation of U.S. inflation data, which could influence monetary policy decisions impacting the region. Amidst this backdrop, identifying promising stocks involves looking for companies that demonstrate resilience and potential growth despite broader market volatility. Top 10 Undiscovered Gems With Strong Fundamentals In The Middle East Click here to see the full list of 225 stocks from our Middle Eastern Undiscovered Gems With Strong Fundamentals screener. We're going to check out a few of the best picks from our screener tool. Overview: Drake and Scull International P.J.S.C. operates in the construction sector across multiple countries including the United Arab Emirates, Saudi Arabia, and Egypt, with a market capitalization of approximately AED1.01 billion. Operations: Drake and Scull International P.J.S.C. derives its revenue primarily from the Wastewater Treatment and Water Sludge segment, which generated AED103.30 million. Drake and Scull International, a construction player in the Middle East, has turned its fortunes around by becoming profitable this year. A significant AED 3.8 billion one-off gain bolstered its financial results as of March 2025. The company now boasts positive shareholder equity, a marked improvement from five years ago when it was negative. Despite not being free cash flow positive, DSI's price-to-earnings ratio stands at an attractive 0.3x compared to the local market average of 13.2x, suggesting potential undervaluation. Recent earnings showed sales of AED 30 million with net income reaching AED 2 million from a previous loss position.
• Dive into the specifics of Drake and Scull International P.J.S.C here with our thorough health report. DFM:DSI Debt to Equity as at Aug 2025
summary: The Middle East markets have seen mixed performances, with shares fluctuating due to corporate earnings and the anticipated U.S. inflation data. The focus of our search is on companies that demonstrate resilience and potential growth despite market volatility. The list includes Drake and Scull International, a construction company that operates in multiple countries across the Middle East. Despite not being free cash flow positive, DSI's price-to-earth ratio stands at an attractive 0.3x compared to the local market average of 13.2x.
shortSummary: The Middle East's Undiscovered Gems feature notable companies like Drake and Scull International, which have improved profitability and potential growth prospects amid market volatility.

About the Company
| Founded | Employees | CEO | Website |
|---|---|---|---|
| 2006 | 145 | n/a | www.miateknoloji.com |
MIA Teknoloji Anonim Sirketi provides software development services to public and private organizations in Turkey. The company offers Pizzy, an integrated facility management software; BIO-ID, a biometric data management software; MIA-SOFT, a multimodal biometric authentication and identification software; MBIS, a multi biometric identification system; Surveillance, an environmental surveillance and face recognition system; MIA-MED, a hospital information management system software; traffic monitoring software; and ID-100B, a multi biometric identification unit. It also provides identification and authentication, environmental surveillance, intelligent traffic inspection, shared mobility, renewable energy, information technologies, facility security and management, city security, health informatics technologies, e-vehicle charging network, cyber security, critical facility security and management, defense and immersive technologies, sustainable and zero carbon, and sustainable agriculture and food safety solutions.
